clinical_study.brief_title: DVD-based HIV/HCV Prevention Intervention for Drug-Involved Latino Criminal Justice Clients
clinical_study.official_title: DVD-based HIV/HCV Intervention for Drug-Involved Latino Criminal Justice Clients

oversight_info.authority: United States: Data Monitoring and Safety Board

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

arm_group.description: DVD Intervention presented at one 90 minute group session
Group will get no intervention until after 90 day follow up

intervention.description: Participants will be randomly assigned, with a baseline and 3 month follow up assessments

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- must be between 18 - 49 years of age
- self-identify as Hispanic or Latino
- be involved in the criminal justice system
- report a history of drug use
- be in an outpatient substance abuse program
- self-identify as heterosexual
Exclusion Criteria:
- be HIV positive
- be cognitively impaired

facility.name: University of Delaware Center for Drug and Alcohol Studies
